data.title: Grand!
data.text: Love this theatre!  One of the few old, glamorous theaters left.  On a recent trip to Newport Beach we had dinner and then stopped in at the Lido to see 'Sully'.  Love the old Hollywood feel of this theater!

data.title: Beautiful theater
data.text: We went to see the theater itself not a movie-- it was beautiful and art deco style. I felt like I was in miami beach, but it was very cool to see in person. If you are going to the area I'd check it out.

data.title: Beautiful theater, terrible movies
data.text: I live around the street and I look for any excuse to visit the theater. The best time of year is when they host screenings for the Newport Beach Film Festival (usually in April), when they show a variety of films in quick succession. Otherwise, whoever does their movies selection tends to choose lousy ones (subjectively speaking) and they tend to run for 6+ weeks each. That said, the theater itself is gorgeous; it wouldn't look out of place on Ocean Drive in Miami, with it's tropical Deco architecture and color scheme. They also serve fantastic food, including bon bons and wine.

data.title: STAY AWAY !!
data.text: Saw Andrew Dice Clay. Took us 40 minutes to get our wrist bands to get in. Total mayhem. People cutting in line, obnoxious security, 1 guy doing wristbands for the entire event. People were furious. Lines for drinks took forever, theatre was hot and has no AC. Lights were out in the mens bathroom. This place is horribly managed and under staffed and it was very obvious to all last night. I would NEVER go back to see an entertainer there. SAVE YOUR MONEY and go somewhere else.

data.title: Best Venue
data.text:
Lido Theatre is located in Newport Beach. They have live concerts and show movies.  I went to see the band Long Run in February with two friends.  ID must be shown as they serve alcohol.  Parking is street and a lot at the end of the street. 

Great venue...great concert, intimate, no bad seat in the house, dancing up front.  Excellent. I would go again.

data.title: Check it out during Newport Beach film festival
data.text: Old time movie theatre, that was revamped a bit, so inside is ok.  They seem to only show "artsie" movies no one wants to see.  Sometimes they have showings of the newport film festival here, so that was very nice.

data.title: "Those Were the Days"
data.text: Back in the Days my Friend, I thought they would never end, "Those Were the Days".  A group of fellow travelers on a Magical Mystery Tour, took a ride one night, 1967, levitating through the Lido Theatre door, playing was the Yellow Submarine, all in attendance were invited by a collective empathic consciousness, everything was said without a whispered word.  We thought that we could change the world, create a Shangrila, Humans acting with humanity, well we know what happened, not what we had envisioned in our young idealistic souls.  Maybe if we vote Republican, 2016 things will change for the better?  Sincerely, Robert Miller, LuxModRedux Gallery, Newport Beach, CA.

data.title: Love the Lido Theatre!
data.text: We attended the Queen Nation Concert in January at the Lido Theatre and had a fabulous experience.  We love the Queen tribute band, but seeing them in this small, intimate theatre, was just icing on the cake! This art-deco venue, is fantastic. It will be even better once they get a food and beverage license so they can serve something besides hot dogs and popcorn.

data.title: Cool
data.text: This little art deco gem is very cool. Back in the day, going to the movies was an event, and this theatre represents that made of mind!

data.title: Classic OLD Theatre
data.text: Not too many of these left! The LIDO is a ONE screen old fashioned theatre, but well restored and preserved. Marine art from the 40's decorates the walls and ceilings.  Love it.

data.title: Throw back and a gem.
data.text: Great little theater - give it a try. New movies in an updated old fashioned (clean and remodeled) little theater. No hassles and easy access. Nice to be in a stand alone without a big mall!

data.title: An Art Deco Gem!
data.text:
The Lido, its neon Grand Marquee, and old-fashioned ticket booth are so charming.  Inside you'll find little touches, red velvet comfortable seats, a powder room inspired by Bette Davis (who insisted the Ladies Room be located on the main floor), neon lights, painted sea life on the walls, and balcony seating.

We love the Lido Theater!

data.title: Funky & fabulous
data.text: This theater takes you back to when you were a kid and there were still balcony seats and a single free standing ticket booth. It is so cool inside - day glow underwater scenes on the walls and old time sconces on the walls. Clean and fresh inside with nicely upholstered seats and pleasant people working the snack bar. I always make a point of it to try to go to this theater instead of a big box theater whenever I can. A little slice of yesteryear.

data.title: Lido Villiage
data.text: Lido Theater is a nice vintage, small town theatre but there is nothing else to do aronud there. The village other than Lido Book Store (which is wonderful!!!!) is a dead zone all boat charter places, no palce to eat or shop.

data.title: Step Back In Time
data.text: Love this little retro theatre. It shows first rate films and is part of the Newport Beach Film Festival! It's like going to another era when movie houses were truly grand, personal & timeless.

data.title: See movie like you are at home.
data.text: The huge reclining leather chair is a great plus and you can have wine served while watching the movies.   It's worth the extra dollars.

data.title: Beautiful and historic
data.text: Perfect setting to see the Monuments Men movie.  We liked the balcony, terrific view of the screen and comfortable too.

data.title: Wonderful old/restored Art Deco style movie theatre
data.text: We live close, so we ride our bikes there and enjoy first run and/or art house movies. It's a small theatre - and I love the day glow fish on the walls, when the lights get turned down. A true "blast from the past"!  There's even a Balcony area!

data.title: Still cool after all these years!
data.text: I still love the Lido Theater. It only plays one film at a time, it has just a little box office and a funky little snack bar, but it is so cool inside with it's balcony, florescent paint on the ceiling and walls with fish swimming along and shells and sand. They always have the best movies there and it is actually pretty large inside so even when there are lots of people lined up outside there is usually plenty of seats to choose from inside. Clean, well managed, well taken care of, what more could you ask for!

data.title: A landmark!
data.text: Open in the 1930s this is a major landmark of Newport beach. Come watch Newport movie festival.  I have watched some classics here and had a great time
